page.title: 11Abbots or Abbotts
page.content: Why is there a difference in the spelling of "Abbot" in Abbots Farm School and "Abbott" in Abbotts Way? Both spellings occur in the minutes of the Borough and County Councils. It has been Suggested that the name derives from the Abbot of Pipewell or a family called Abbot(t) who used to own the land on which the estate and schools were built. In the old days there were frequently variations in the spelling of surnames. A map going back to the end of the last century shows a house called "Abbots". There is also reference to an "Abbott Charity" at around the same time. No doubt both versions can be justified, but it would have been tidier if only one of them had been adopted for both school and road.
